title: Basel Iii Principles
text:
Basel III (capital adequacy and risk management) – excerpted principles relevant to credit decisions:
- Banks must hold sufficient capital against credit risk; decisions should account for probability of default, loss given default, and exposure at default.
- Risk-weighted assets (RWA) must reflect the risk profile of exposures; high debt-to-income or poor credit history should increase perceived risk.
- Stress testing and prudent underwriting should be documented; explanations should reference solvency and repayment capacity when relevant.
- Disclosures should be clear and support supervisory review; credit denials should highlight material risk factors.

title: Gdpr Article 22
text:
GDPR Article 22 (Automated individual decision-making, including profiling):
- Individuals have the right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing that produces legal or similarly significant effects.
- Such decisions require suitable safeguards, including the right to obtain human intervention, to express a point of view, and to contest the decision.
- Explanations should identify the main factors driving the decision and how they relate to the individual’s data.
- Profiling and automated credit decisions must be transparent and fair, especially when impacting access to financial services.

title: Mifid Ii Transparency
text:
MiFID II (investor protection and transparency) – excerpted principles relevant to automated decisions:
- Communications and recommendations must be fair, clear, and not misleading; key factors influencing a decision should be disclosed.
- Suitability and appropriateness assessments should consider the customer’s profile, risk tolerance, and objectives.
- Conflicts of interest must be managed and disclosed; automated advice or decisions should not disadvantage clients unfairly.
- Records should be kept to evidence how decisions were made and which inputs were considered material.
